title: Scurvy is Back
patient: The second case (patient 2) was a 61-year-old gentleman, heavy alcoholic, with a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. He presented with an upper gastrointestinal bleed secondary to gastric ulceration and was treated with proton pump inhibitors. He had limited food intake, preferring to spend his money on alcohol. He lived alone with no social support. On examination, he was emaciated, with multiple bruises, poor dentition with bleeding gums, and telangiectasia. Blood tests showed low levels of vitamin C (0.21 mg/dL). His gamma-glutamyltransferase was raised, but there were no other signs of liver failure.
